title: Former Warner Chilcott exec's kickbacks trial on tap for May
altHeadline: Former Warner Chilcott exec's kickbacks trial on tap for May
teaser: A much-watched pharma kickbacks case goes to trial next month. W. Carl Reichel, a former Warner Chilcott president, faces charges of conspiring to pay kickbacks to doctors.

arcImage.alt: Justice statue with sword and scales
arcImage.caption: none

title: UPDATED: J&J's Invokana under scrutiny in EU for potential link to toe amputations
altHeadline: J&J's Invokana under review in EU for possible link to toe amputations
teaser: J&J's hot-selling diabetes drug Invokana has already caught attention in the U.S. for safety issues, and now, it's facing a new review in Europe for a potential link to toe amputations.

title: What's in a name? Plenty, if you're in the Merck vs. Merck trademark fight
altHeadline: Merck hits back at Merck in U.S. trademark fight
teaser: The Merck vs. Merck tug of war over trademark rights just heated up, as the German company hit back at its U.S.-based rival with its own allegations.

arcImage.alt: Merck KGaA new logo in front of building

title: AstraZeneca eyes Xtandi windfall with potential £7B bid for Medivation
altHeadline: AstraZeneca eyes Xtandi windfall with potential £7B bid for Medivation
teaser: Medivation reportedly turned down a recent bid from Sanofi--and now, it looks as if AstraZeneca may swoop in with its own £7 billion bid for the biotech, which makes the prostate cancer pill Xtandi.

title: Ogilvy CommonHealth primes cloud marketing platform with doctor data
altHeadline: Ogilvy CommonHealth primes marketing platform with doctor data
teaser: Want to find and target specific types of doctors, individually? Ogilvy CommonHealth Worldwide just launched a proprietary marketing cloud platform with 5.5 million detailed physician profiles.

title: New York AG sues insurer over restrictive hep C coverage
altHeadline: New York AG sues insurer over restrictive hep C coverage
teaser: The New York State Attorney General has already taken some steps to find out why insurers are limiting coverage of pricey hep C meds to the sickest patients but has stopped short of suing companies for their decisions. Now, he’s stepping up his fight. New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman’s office is suing health insurer CDPHP for breaking the law by delaying coverage of hep C treatments until patients are in advanced stages of the disease, The Times Union reports. The said AG in a suit filed in a state Supreme Court that the Albany, NY-based insurer did not pay for medically necessary care and deceived members about their coverage.

arcImage.caption: New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman

title: WuXi’s Crelux acquisition to boost European expansion
altHeadline: WuXi’s Crelux acquisition to boost European expansion
teaser: WuXi AppTec has bought Germany-based drug discovery provider Crelux as the Chinese company looks to move more deeply into Europe.

title: Eisai gains Philippines approval for Aricept in new license
altHeadline: Eisai gains Philippines approval for Aricept in new license
teaser: Seventeen years after the Philippines first approved Eisai and Pfizer’s Alzheimer’s drug Aricept, the country has now granted a new license for patients with Lewy body dementia.

title: Pfizer delay, alleged price gouging earns wrath of British watchdog
altHeadline: Pfizer delay, alleged price gouging earns wrath of British watchdog
teaser: In case anyone thought it was just the U.S. where pharma is accused of hiking prices, the U.K. has been quick to remind everyone it happens across the pond, hitting Pfizer with a £10,000 penalty.

title: Will new drug spending figures increase pressure on pharma?
altHeadline: Will new drug spending figures increase pressure on pharma?
teaser: The annual report on how much the U.S. pays for meds is out--and it will likely serve to further anger those who believe pharma is hiking its prices.
